title: EXCLUSIVE: Hector Berrellez: I Had Numerous Shootouts w/ Cartels, Brother Addicted to Heroin at 12 | VladTV
text: Watch the full interview now as a VladTV Youtube Member: [Click Here](https://www.youtube.com/vladtv/join) Part 5: [Hector Berrellez on Why U.S. Won't Classify Cartels as Terrorists: Cartels Make $50 Billion](https://www.vladtv.com/article/302657/hector-berrellez-on-why-u-s-won-t-classify-cartels-as-terrorists-cartels) Part 1: [Hector Berrellez Describes Transnational Criminal Organizations (TCO)](https://www.vladtv.com/article/302547/hector-berrellez-describes-transnational-criminal-organizations-tco) In this clip, Hector Berrellez openly discussed the ongoing drug crisis which Mexico has been supplying to the US since the 80s and 90s. Hector courageously confessed that he assumed his role not for the sake of a job or promotion but because he personally witnessed the suffering caused by drug addiction in his own family and community. Hector also highlighted the high profitability of the drug trade, in which one kilo of 90% pure heroin bought for $250,000 can be broken down into ten kilos for distribution, maximizing profit. Despite the risk to his life, he continues to combat drug cartels, criticizing the Mexican government's inadequate response and warning that the glamorization of drug lords in songs and movies influences others to aspire to be drug dealers. The desperation for a better life often drives people into drug dealing, consequently contributing to the continuous drug crisis. Interview by: Shawn Prez Check out his youtube channel at: [https://www.youtube.com/c/PowerMoveMakers](https://www.youtube.com/c/PowerMoveMakers)
